name: Sidney Jones
title: Lead Software Engineer — AI
summary: Hands-on solution leader with 20+ years of experience modernizing enterprise systems, integrating pricing and ERP platforms, and architecting secure, data-driven solutions. Proven track record transforming legacy applications into scalable, object-oriented, service-based architectures. Deep expertise in C#, Python, SQL Server, Oracle, and modern integration patterns (SOAP/REST, JSON, MQ). Adept at leading cross-functional teams to deliver modernization, pricing, and automation initiatives that align with business growth and global expansion.
core_competencies: Application Modernization: Monolith-to-microservice migrations, CRM refactoring, and API-first design.
Enterprise Pricing & CPQ: Integration of rule-based pricing and configuration engines.
Data & Integration: SQL (T-SQL/PL-SQL), SSIS, event streaming, XML/JSON APIs.
Cloud & DevOps: Azure & AWS, Terraform, GitHub Actions, Jenkins CI/CD pipelines.
Security & Compliance: AES-256, KeeperSecurity, DevSecOps, RBAC.
Leadership & Collaboration: Mentorship, architecture governance, stakeholder alignment.
core_strengths: Authentication, Authorization & Role-Based Access Control (OAuth2, OIDC, JWT)
LLM Integration, Prompt Pipelines, Agent Runtimes

tech_stack.languages: Python, TypeScript, Go, JavaScript, C#, SQL
tech_stack.frameworks: FastAPI, Flask, React, Next.js, Spring Boot
tech_stack.cloud_devops: AWS (Lambda, API Gateway, S3, DynamoDB), Azure Functions, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes
tech_stack.ai_ml: OpenAI, Anthropic, LangChain, Agentic SDKs, Vector Databases, MLOps Pipelines

technical_proficiencies.cloud_platforms: Azure, AWS, Azure Functions, AKS, Azure AD, App Services
technical_proficiencies.devops_automation: Terraform, Bicep, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes
technical_proficiencies.infrastructure_security: RBAC, Palo Alto Firewall Integration, ExpressRoute, Private Link, Managed Identity, KeeperSecurity, AES-256 Encryption
technical_proficiencies.monitoring_observability: Azure Monitor, Dynatrace, Log Analytics, Application Insights
technical_proficiencies.compliance: NIST, CIS, SOC/SIEM Integration (QRadar), DevSecOps, FinOps

bullets.text: Led modernization of financial and healthcare platforms by rearchitecting legacy systems into modular, service-based applications using C#, Python, and SQL Server.
Developed secure pricing and billing APIs leveraging AES-256 encryption, integrating KeeperSecurity-managed keys for compliance with financial and healthcare regulations.
Engineered ETL pipelines and ERP integrations (Paylocity, Salesforce, and custom CRMs), automating rate management and data reconciliation across systems.
Modernized monolithic billing modules into object-oriented microservices supporting dynamic rate computation and margin analysis.
Designed REST/SOAP integration services using .NET Core and FastAPI to link legacy systems with modern pricing engines.
Implemented CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins and GitHub Actions, introducing automated build validation and rollback automation for critical production systems.
Partnered with leadership to define modernization OKRs, aligning technical outcomes with business efficiency and scalability goals.
Directed modernization of legacy APIs and backend systems into service-based frameworks, ensuring scalability and maintainability.
Integrated KeeperSecurity-managed AES-256 key infrastructure to secure pricing and PII data exchange between legacy CRM and AWS Lambda services.
Developed event-driven microservices for pricing and financial forecasting pipelines, bridging Python, .NET, and Java ecosystems.
Automated infrastructure provisioning with Terraform and optimized CI/CD using GitHub Actions and Azure DevOps.

experience.role: Principal Consultant / Platform Team Delivery Lead

bullets.text: Modernized enterprise “Online Access” platform from VBScript monoliths to microservice and micro-frontend architecture using Java, Python, and C#.
Designed pricing and transaction APIs for portfolio valuation workflows, integrating real-time SQL Server and Oracle data sources.
Orchestrated cross-team modernization pipelines in Azure DevOps with Terraform, achieving 50 % faster releases.
Developed web-based financial and compliance applications integrating Salesforce, AWS, and internal data systems.
Established CI/CD pipelines with automated testing and trunk-based branching, reducing manual deployment steps by > 60 %.
Mentored junior developers on modern DevOps, continuous testing, and microservice decomposition.
Led modernization of the enterprise-scale ERP system supporting 400+ retail sites across North America, establishing one of the company’s first automated build and test pipelines.
Introduced continuous integration and unit-test enforcement, paving the way for trunk-based development years before mainstream DevOps adoption.

Architected Wells Fargo Level III–certified payment microservices, processing $1 M+ in daily settlements and generating over $500 K in annual savings through secure, low-latency transaction automation.
Migrated ERP modules to Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R2, modularizing procurement, logistics, and accounting components into independently deployable services.
Mentored distributed teams on code quality, release automation, and early CI/CD concepts, cultivating a delivery-first engineering culture.
Directed modernization of corporate IT across 25 U.S. locations, designing a hybrid AWS EC2 cloud architecture and automating deployments through early DevOps pipelines.
Introduced Infrastructure-as-Code and configuration automation for ERP subsystems, enabling consistent builds and reducing release time from days to hours.
Unified eight disparate ERP systems using MVVM and service-oriented design, consolidating operations under a single enterprise application.
Partnered with network engineering to redesign server infrastructure and implement proactive monitoring, reducing IT costs by $250 K annually.
Established branching and integration practices that later evolved into full trunk-based development across distributed teams.
Engineered enterprise-scale QA automation and load-testing frameworks (QALoad, QADirector) used by clients such as Ford, GM, and Blue Cross, standardizing test execution across distributed systems.
Developed E2E automation frameworks in C++ and Java that integrated performance testing directly into the earliest DevOps pipelines.
Automated defect-tracking and regression testing processes, increasing release velocity and reliability for large-scale automotive and healthcare platforms.
Created internal performance benchmarking utilities that evolved into global commercial QA products, improving observability and continuous feedback for engineering teams.
Collaborated across dev, QA, and product teams to institutionalize continuous testing culture that predated modern CI/CD adoption.

experience.role: Software Engineer – Vehicle Diagnostics & Embedded Systems

bullets.text: Developed next-generation diagnostic tools for OEM clients including Harley-Davidson, Isuzu, and Penske, enabling technicians to analyze, calibrate, and service vehicles through dynamic data interfaces.

Engineered data-driven diagnostic frameworks in C and C++ for multiple communication protocols (J1850, J1939, CAN, ISO 9141), ensuring real-time vehicle data acquisition and cross-platform compatibility.

Designed modular ECM communication libraries capable of detecting and adapting to new OEM protocols without re-engineering the core stack — a precursor to today's plugin and microservice architectures.
Collaborated with firmware and field engineering teams to validate tool accuracy and performance across diverse vehicle ECUs, integrating live telemetry capture and automated fault detection.
Implemented early test-automation suites for calibration and service modules, reducing regression time and establishing repeatable quality benchmarks adopted across client programs.
Authored internal documentation and training materials to standardize diagnostic protocol handling, accelerating onboarding for new engineers and OEM partners.

experience.role: Junior Software Developer – Vehicle Communications & Diagnostics

bullets.text: Contributed to the development of embedded diagnostic software and communication utilities for heavy-duty and automotive OEMs including GM, Freightliner, and Detroit Diesel, forming the basis of what became Nexiq's flagship USB Link diagnostic interface.
Developed C++ modules for ECM/TCM communication supporting multiple transport layers (J1850 VPW, PWM, CAN, ISO 9141, and J1939) used in early vehicle network testing tools.
Assisted in implementing protocol parsers, data loggers, and error-code interpreters, enabling real-time fault detection and calibration analysis across multiple vehicle control modules.
Collaborated with senior firmware engineers to integrate embedded serial communication stacks and perform bench validation using oscilloscopes, breakout boxes, and early CAN analyzers.
Supported initial automation of test workflows through batch scripting and unit harnesses, reducing manual regression validation time by over 30%.
Documented diagnostic APIs and assisted in preparing SDK materials for OEM and aftermarket developers.

bridge_paragraph: These early leadership and engineering experiences at Compuware, Soave, and John Deere built my foundation in automated quality, scalable architecture, and continuous integration—skills that now underpin my work in AI-driven software delivery systems.

certifications.name: ICAgile Certified Professional - Agile Team Facilitation
ICAgile Certified Professional - Foundations of DevOps
ICAgile Certified Professional - Business Agility Foundations
